def pivot_table(
        data,
        values=None,
        index=None,
        columns=None,
        aggfunc="mean",
        fill_value=None,
        margins=False,
        dropna=True,
        margins_name="All",
        observed=False,
) -> "DataFrame":
    # Omitted for brevity: the unchanged part of the original function

    keys = index + columns
    
    # Use the pivot_table function's ability to create multi-index columns
    table = data.pivot_table(
        values=values,
        index=index,
        columns=columns,
        aggfunc=aggfunc,
        fill_value=fill_value,
        margins=margins,
        dropna=dropna,
        observed=observed
    )

    if margins:
        if dropna:
            data = data[data.notna().all(axis=1)]
        table_with_margins = _add_margins(
            table,
            data,
            values,
            rows=index,
            cols=columns,
            aggfunc=aggfunc,
            observed=dropna,
            margins_name=margins_name,
            fill_value=fill_value,
        )
        return table_with_margins

    return table
